components.description:
A pair of eyes, glancing slightly to the left on most platforms. The Google version of this emoji previously showed only a single eye, despite the name of this character being eyes (plural).

Sometimes used to indicate ‘pervy eyes’ to indicate approval of an attractive photo posted online; or ‘shifty eyes’ to convey a deceitful act.
components.title: Eyes

description:
A pair of eyes, glancing slightly to the left on most platforms. The Google version of this emoji previously showed only a single eye, despite the name of this character being eyes (plural).

Sometimes used to indicate ‘pervy eyes’ to indicate approval of an attractive photo posted online; or ‘shifty eyes’ to convey a deceitful act.
title: Eyes

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Facial parts symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A pair of eyes, glancing slightly to the left on most platforms. The Google version of this emoji previously showed only a single eye, despi http://emojipedia.org/eyes/
emoji_net_data.name: eyes

bn:13700534a: A little scared; worried by a feeling or event. Describing the unsettling feeling there being another unknown ghostly presence.

bn:13700535a: Being spied upon by security or intelligence services.

bn:00107730a: Of, or relating to sight; visual
Of or relating to the eye or to vision.
Of, or relating to the eye or to vision.
Of, or relating to the eye, or the sense of sight

bn:00096641a: (used of eyes) open and fixed as if in fear or wonder

bn:00088869v: Throw a glance at; take a brief look at
To take a glance at something.

bn:00090448v: To try to see, to pay attention to with one's eyes.
Perceive with attention; direct one's gaze towards

bn:00087940v: To gauge, estimate or judge by eye; to look or glance at.

bn:00093430v: Perceive by sight or have the power to perceive by sight
To perceive by the visual faculty.
To perceive or detect with the eyes, or as if by sight.
To see, or to look at.

bn:00046516n: A person, especially as one among many.
An individual is a person or a specific object.
A single physical human being as a legal subject, as opposed to a legal person such as a corporation.
A human; someone susceptible to death.

A person is a being, such as a human, that has certain capacities or attributes constituting personhood, which in turn is defined differently by different authors in different disciplines, and by different cultures in different times and places.
A person that will die eventually.
A being, such as a human, that has certain capacities or attributes constituting personhood
Abstract term defining a being, e.g. a human, that has certain capacities or attributes constituting personhood (not for use with "instance of" [P31], instead use "human" [Q5])
An individual; usually a human being.

bn:00032512n: An organ of vision that detects light
Organ that detects light and converts it into electro-chemical impulses in neurons
The two eyes of a human being considered as a whole.
A window or other opening that has an oval or circular shape (as of an eye).
An organ through which animals see.
Eyes are sensory organs of the face responsible for sight.
An oculus, plural oculi, from Latin oculus: eye, denotes a circular opening in the center of a dome or in a wall.
Eyes are the organs of vision.
The part of the eye having a spherical shape.
The organ that is sensitive to light, which it converts to electrical signals passed to the brain, by which means animals see.

bn:00016715n: In general, detection is the extraction of particular information from a larger stream of information without specific cooperation from or synchronization with the sender.
Act of detecting or sensing something.
Act of detecting something with a detector.
The act of detecting something; catching sight of something
The act of detecting or sensing something; discovering something that was hidden or disguised.

bn:00051968n: The act of directing the eyes toward something and perceiving it visually
The act of directing the eyes toward something and perceiving it visually.
Looking is an American comedy-drama television series about a group of friends living in San Francisco.

apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the eyes emoji are depicted with striking realism, featuring luminous irises that draw the viewer in. Apple's signature 3D shading and subtle highlights give them a lifelike depth, suggesting attentiveness and keen observation. Whether conveying a sense of curiosity, a watchful presence, or simply acknowledging something interesting, these expressive eyes on your Apple device are a versatile and engaging communication tool.
